Virgil van Dijk is in line to make his Liverpool debut in the FA Cup third-round tie with Everton a week tomorrow, writes @_pauljoyce

He has signed a five-and-a-half-year deal that will run until the summer of 2023 and is worth about £180,000 a week. Van Dijk, whose fee outstrips the £54 million that City paid Tottenham Hotspur for Kyle Walker, will wear the No 4 jersey. (Paul Joyce)

Van Dijk, who is likely to be at Anfield on Saturday when Jürgen Klopp’s side face Leicester City, did not give up on his ambition to play for Liverpool and has overlooked City’s interest once again to realise the desire. (Paul Joyce)

Van Dijk, who is likely to be at Anfield on Saturday when Jürgen Klopp’s side face Leicester City, did not give up on his ambition to play for Liverpool and has overlooked City’s interest once again to realise the desire. (Paul Joyce)
